text: Shamel Jones is a former collegiate basketball player and streetball player. Jones skipped over St John's University, UNLV, and TCU to play for Georgetown. Jones originally played for the 1996–97 Georgetown Hoyas men's basketball team and later the University of Memphis. He took Memphis to the NIT championships during his time there. The 6'9 forward originally played for Paul Robeson HS along with Lamar Odom. He was considered to be a city Basketball legend. He played basketball in Brazil for Winner/Kabum Limeira. He teamed with James Speedy Williams in streetball tournaments in New York City. ==References== Category:Living people Category:Memphis Tigers men's basketball players Category:Georgetown Hoyas men's basketball players Category:American expatriate basketball people in Brazil Category:American men's basketball players Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Shamel Jones
